original: Bolin, Hans Mikael, överstelöjtnant, Karlskrona, f. 29/9/95 i Ronneby av rektor Ado’lf B. o. Selma Söhrling. G. 20 m. Erna Bolin. Barn: Bertil f. 22, Lars 28. — Stud:ex. i Upps. 15, off :ex. 17, Gci 21-22, KSHS 24-25, GCI 26-27, gaskurs 28. Fänr. v. kustart. 17, löjtn. 19, kapt. 32, major 40, öv:löjtn. 43. Kadettofif. v. pansarkryss. Fylgias vinterexp. 32-33, chef f. IV. bat. v. KA. 2, personalv :off. v. KA. 2 sed. 39. Led. av 45 års mil :utredn., av amiral :f’örs. kyrkoråd, av styr. f. Blek. gymn:förb., sekr. o. ordf. i Karliskrona kustart :reg. IF sed. 25, ’sekr. o. istyr:-’led. i Karlskrona GF ised. 22, ’styr:led. i Blek. idr :förb. -sed. 23 o. i fören. Kariliskrona idr :plats sed. 24, eskader-chef à Carlskrona båteskader. RSO, RVO, RJugKrO, Svmifb GM, Riks-idr:förb. GM, LingM, KA. 2 GM, Blek. gymn:förb. GM, Bdek. ;idr:förb. förtj:t i gu’M m. fl. utmärkelser.
translated: Bolin, Hans Mikael, Lieutenant Colonel, Karlskrona, born September 29, 1895 in Ronneby to Principal Ado'lf B. and Selma Söhrling. Married to Erna Bolin in 1920. Children: Bertil born in 1922, Lars born in 1928. Graduated from Uppsala University in 1915, became a military officer in 1917. Completed Gci in 1921-22, KSHS in 1924-25, GCI in 1926-27 and gas course in 1928. Promoted to Second Lieutenant in coastal artillery in 1917, to Lieutenant in 1919, to Captain in 1932, to Major in 1940, and to Lieutenant Colonel in 1943. Participated in the winter expedition of the cruiser Fylgia in 1932-33, commanded the IV Battalion of the Coastal Artillery in KA. 2, and became the personal officer of KA. 2 in 1939. He was a member of the 45-year Military Investigation, Admiral's Educational Church Council, Board of Directors for Blekinge Gymnastics Association, Secretary and Chairman of the Karlskrona Coastal Artillery Regiment's IF since 1925, Secretary and Board Member of Karlskrona GF since 1922, board member of Blekinge Sports Association since 1923, and a member of the Karlskrona Sports Location Association since 1924. Bolin was also a commander of the Karlskrona boat squadrons. He was awarded the RSO, RVO, RJugKrO, Svmifb GM, Riks-idr:förb. GM, LingM, KA. 2 GM, Blek. gymn:förb. GM, Blek. idr:förb. förtj:t in gu'M and other honors.
